channel.description: Recent content in Colossians on Christian Internet Resources

item.title: Colossians 1
item.description:
Colossians Chapter 1

1 Paul, apostle of-Christ Jesus through (the) will of-God, and Timothy the brother, 2to-the saints in Colossae and faithful brothers in Christ. Grace to-you and peace from God (the) Father of-us.

3 We-thak [the] God (the) Father of-the Lord of-us Jesus Christ, praying always about you, 4having-heard-about the faith of-you in Christ Jesus and the love that you-have unto all the saints 5through the hope [the] stored-up for-you in [the] heaven[s], which you-previously-heard-about in the word of-the truth of-the gospel, 6the-One being-present in you even-as also in all the world it-is bearing-fruit and growing even-as also in you from which day you-heard (it) and came-to-know the grace of-[the God in truth. 7Even-as you-learned from Epaphras, the beloved fellow-servant of-us, who is (a) faithful minister of-[the] Christ on-behalf-of you, 8the-one also having-made-evident to-us the love of-you in (the) Spirit.

item.title: Colossians 2
item.description:
Colossians Chapter 2

1 For I-want you to-know how-great (a) struggle I-have on-behalf-of you and the–ones in Laodicea, even as-many-as have┘not└seen the face of-me in (the) flesh, 2in-order-that the hearts of-them might-be-comforted, being-held-together in love even unto all (the) wealth of-the full-assurance of-[the] understanding unto (the) knowledge of-the mystery of-[the] God, (which is) Christ, 3in whom are all the treasures of-[the] wisdom and knowledge hidden. 4I-say this in-order-that nobody may lead┘you└astray with attractive-argument. 5For even if I-am-absent with-the flesh, I-am nevertheless with you in spirit, rejoicing and seeing the orderliness of-you and the steadfastness of-the faith of-you in Christ.

item.title: Colossians 3
item.description:
Colossians Chapter 3

1 If then you-were-raised-with [the] Christ, seek the-things above, where [the] Christ is-seated on (the) right (hand) of-[the] God. 2Set-your-mind-on the-things above, not the-things on [the] earth. 3For you-died and the life of-you has-been-hidden with Christ in [the] God. 4When [the] Christ, the life of-you, appears, then you also will-be-manifested with him in glory.

5 Therefore put-to-death the members [the] on the earth: sexual-immorality, uncleanness, passion, evil desire, and [the] greed, which is idolatry. 6On-account-of which-things the wrath of-[the] God comes [on the sons of-[the] disobedience]ms, 7in which-things you also once walked, when you were-living in these-things, 8and/but now you also put┘all the-things└asideimparative: anger, rage, hateful feelings, slander, shameful talk from your mouth. 9Do┘not└lie to one-another, having-taken-off the old man with the practices of-it, 10and having-put-on the new (man), the-one being-made-new to knowledge according-to (the) image of-the-One having-created him, 11where there-is not Greek and Jew, circumcision and uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, slave, free; but Christ (is) [the]ms all-things and in all (things).

item.title: Colossians 4
item.description:
Colossians Chapter 4

1 The] masters, give the/your slaves the just-thing and [the] fairness, knowing that you also have (a) Master in heaven.

2 Devote-yourselves to-[the] prayer, being-vigilant in it in thanksgiving, 3praying at-the-same-time/together also about us, in-order-that [the] God may-open for-us (a) door of-the word to-speak the mystery of-[the] Christ, on-account-lf which also I-have-been-put-in-prison. 4(Pray) in-order-that I-will-make┘it└manifest as it-is-necessary for-me to-speak. 5Walk in wisdom toward the-ones outside, making-good-use-of the opportunity. 6(Let) the word of-you always (be) in grace, seasoned with-salt, to-know-how it-is-necessary for-us to-answer each one.
